page.title: 09A LOCAL TRUCK DRIVER'S DAY
page.content: My dad gets up at 4.30 a.m. After a mug of coffee and cereal for breakfast he leaves the house by car.On arriving at the depot in{Holsworthy,}he checks in and sets off for work in the truck. From Launceston he travels to Exeter Plymouth, Tavistock, St Austell and Truro. His job is collecting{eggs}from local farms and taking them to the {depot.}He drives either a 16 ton Ford Cargo or an E.R.F. and carries 4000 eggs in dozen boxes. At the back is a loading lift to raise 1000 Kg. In the cab is his C.B.radio and another radio. When it is lunch-time, he has a snack lunch in the cab. In the afternoon he continues his rounds and usually finishes about 5 p.m.Mum finds the{micro-wave}cooker useful to cook his meals quickly when he arrives. He has very little leisure time as he goes to bed early.
